intro: Rigiolepis uniflora var. pedicellata, commonly known as the slender-flowered rigiolepis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, single flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils, preferring full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the inflorescence consists of a single, elongated flower stalk. This variant is notable for its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
